citation.title: Charge optimized many-body (COMB) potential for Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> materials, interfaces, and nanostructures
citation.abstract: This work presents the development and applications of a new empirical, variable chargepotential for Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> systems within the charge optimized many-body (COMB) potential framework. The potential can describe the fundamental physical properties of Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>, including cohesive energy, elastic constants, defect formation energies, surface energies and phonon properties of α-Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> comparable to that obtained from experiments and first-principles calculations. The potential is further employed in classical molecular dynamics (MD) simulations to validate and predict the properties of the Al (1 1 1)–Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> (0 0 0 1) interface, tensile properties of Al nanowires, Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> nanowires, Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>-covered Al nanowires, and defective Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub> nanowires. The results demonstrate that the potential is well-suited to model heterogeneous material systems involving Al and Al<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>. Most importantly, the parameters can be seamlessly coupled with COMB3 parameters for other materials to enable MD simulations of a wide range of heterogeneous material systems.
